appendix.title: About &susemgr; and Spacewalk
appendix.para: &susemgrreg;'s main purpose is to efficiently manage a set of Linux systems and keep them up-to-date. You can register both &slereg; and &rhel; client systems with the &susemgr; server.

&susemgr; is based on the Spacewalk project, . This allows for seamless migration when switching from &rh; Satellite or a Spacewalk server to &susemgr;. User experience and tools are mostly unchanged, which means that you can use the known commands and the scripts that may already exist on your systems.
However, as &susemgr; is deployed as an appliance based on &sle;, some differences exist regarding environments and tools:

listitem.para: Instead of connecting to &rhn;, &susemgr; connects to &ncc; (NCC) () to receive updates and patches. NCC also provides the entitlements for enabling specific &susemgr; functionality.
Automated installation on &rhel; client systems is done with Kickstart. For &sle; client systems, &susemgr; uses &ay;.
Is done with yum on &rhel; client systems. For &sle; client systems, &susemgr; uses zypper.

The Spacewalk command line tools also work for &susemgr;. Additionally, symbolic links have been added for a number of commands. For example, rhn-profile-sync is also available as mgr-profile-sync.
For details, refer to .
